{diagnosis: Vasculitis (e.g., Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (Wegeners), Churg-Strauss Syndrome, Microscopic polyangiitis)

justification: Multi-system involvement with mononeuritis multiplex (vasculitis affecting nerves), arthropathy (joint inflammation), delirium (CNS involvement), and seizures (CNS involvement) makes vasculitis a strong consideration.}, {diagnosis: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)

justification: Autoimmune disease affecting multiple systems including nerves (mononeuritis multiplex), joints (arthropathy), brain (delirium and seizures), and other organs.}, {diagnosis: Sarcoidosis

justification: Inflammatory disease that can cause nerve damage (mononeuritis multiplex), joint pain (arthropathy), and affect the nervous system (delirium, seizures).}, {diagnosis: Infectious diseases (e.g., Lyme disease, HIV, Syphilis)

justification: Infections can cause a wide range of neurological and systemic symptoms including those listed. Specific infections depend on geographic location and risk factors.}, {diagnosis: Neurological Paraneoplastic Syndromes

justification: Immune responses triggered by cancer, sometimes before cancer detection, can cause neurological symptoms like mononeuritis multiplex, seizures, and cognitive changes (delirium).}, {diagnosis: Vitamin B12 Deficiency

justification: Severe deficiency can cause neurological symptoms like peripheral neuropathy (which can manifest as mononeuritis multiplex), delirium, and seizures.}, {diagnosis: Neurological complications of autoimmune diseases (e.g., Rheumatoid arthritis, Sjogrens syndrome)
justification: While less common, existing autoimmune conditions can sometimes lead to neurological complications mimicking the presented symptoms.}, {diagnosis: Metabolic disorders (e.g., Porphyria)

justification: Rarely, metabolic disorders can cause a combination of neurological and systemic symptoms. Porphyria, for example, can cause neurological and psychiatric symptoms.}, {diagnosis: Drug-induced (e.g., certain medications, toxins)

justification: Always consider potential drug-induced causes, as some medications or toxins can cause a wide range of side effects, including neurological and systemic ones.}, {diagnosis: Rare genetic disorders
justification: While less likely, certain rare genetic disorders may manifest with a combination of these symptoms.}
